headline: CrowdStrike, Datadog and other cybersecurity stocks slide after Anthropic's AI tool launch
summary: Shares of cybersecurity companies including CrowdStrike and Datadog slumped on Monday, as investors ‌weighed the potential impact of artificial intelligence startup Anthropic's ‌new security tool on the industry.  Shares of CrowdStrike, Datadog and Zscaler fell around 11%, while those of Fortinet and Okta were down roughly ‌6%.  Palo Alto Networks ⁠dropped 3% and SentinelOne was down by 5%.

headline: Cybersecurity is 'well positioned in the AI age': 3 stock picks
summary: Global X assistant vice president and research analyst Tejas Dessai joins Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss the software sector (IGV), how it's been disrupted by the artificial intelligence (AI) trade, and why he's especially bullish on cybersecurity. Watch the video above to hear some of Dessai's top software and cybersecurity stock picks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) Valuation Check After Recent Share Price Weakness
summary: Recent share performance and business profile Palo Alto Networks (PANW) has been under pressure recently, with the stock showing declines over the past week, month and past 3 months, drawing investor attention to how this cybersecurity business is currently priced. The company reports annual revenue of about US$9.9b and net income of roughly US$1.3b, reflecting a large, global footprint across network security, cloud security and security operations for enterprises and governments.
